headline: Investigation on TikTok’s mental health impact
author: Sydney Kostus
sentences: The investigation is looking to see if the social media app has violated state consumer protection laws by not doing enough to keep young children using the app protected from a potentially harmful impact on their mental and physical health.

STROUDSBURG, MONROE COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — Pennsylvania Attorney General Josh Shapiro has joined other attorneys general by launching an investigation into the social media app ‘TikTok’ and its association with mental health.

“The old days it was you see it on the news at 6, 5 or 11, or maybe the early morning, now it’s 24 hours a day and some kids get enthralled into what they’re seeing and it can really put anxiety levels up,” stated Stern.
Stern says another way to take down the levels of stress from social media is limiting how much you’re using the apps.
